description.content: When you sign up to use ReadyRemit, Brightwell provides (for each of your apps) a `client_id`, `client_secret`, `audience`, and `grant_type` which the app exchanges (via this operation) for an `access_token` for use with other ReadyRemit REST API operations.

response.name: Forbidden

description.content: Given a `countryIso3Code`, this operation returns an array of banks located in that country.

query.description: The search looks for any part of `bankname` in the bank's full name.

description.content: Given a `bankId`, this operation returns an array of branches for that bank. A `bankId` is 1-5 characters. If a `bankId` is 1-5 characters, but the `bankId` does not exist in the database, this operation returns a zero-length array. If the `bankId` is more than 5 characters, this operation returns a status code of 400.

response.name: Success

description.content: This operation returns the array of countries for which the app owner has established corridors. Each record includes a country object and an array of currency objects. The app can present these records to the end user who can choose a recipient country and currency. The process of establishing a corridor involves the app owner, bank, remittance provider, and Brightwell.
This operation returns "OK" if the service is alive and well.

Given a corridor and sender amount, this operation returns a quote including the exchanged amount, fees, and disclosures. The app can present the quote to the end user who can decide whether to proceed with the transfer. Quotes are accurate at the instance of the quote, but rates may change between the time of the quote and the time of the transfer. The Execute Transfer operation returns the final exchange rate.
Given a corridor, this operation returns the required and optional fields for a recipient record. See [Custom fields](https://developer.readyremit.com/reference/about-the-reference#custom-fields).

response.name: Success
Bad Request

description.content: This operation returns all the recipient records associated with the specified `senderId`.

response.name: Forbidden

description.content: This operation creates a recipient record.

response.name: Bad Request

description.content: This operation returns a recipient record for the specified `recipientId`.
This operation updates an entire recipient record.
This operation deletes the recipient record corresponding to the specified `recipientId`.

Given a corridor, this operation returns the required and optional fields for a recipient account record. See [Custom fields](https://developer.readyremit.com/reference/about-the-reference#custom-fields).

response.name: Success
Bad Request

description.content: This operation returns an array of recipient account records associated with the specified recipient identifier.
This operation creates a recipient account record.

response.name: Bad Request

description.content: This operation returns a recipient account record.

response.name: Bad Request

description.content: This operation updates an entire recipient account record.

response.name: Bad Request

description.content: This operation deletes a recipient account record.

response.name: Bad Request

description.content: This operation performs a sender-to-recipient transfer of funds.

response.name: Bad Request
